result.markdown: --- title: "Lab-10: An Invitation from the Queen...to play Croquet" date: 06/June/2022 date-modified: "2023-05-16" subtitle: "The Grammar of Networks" summary: "The Grammar of Networks" author: Arvind Venkatadri order: 100 format: html: code-fold: true code-tools: true code-summary: "Show the Code" --- ![](featured.jpg){fig-align="center" width="389"} ## {{< fa folder-open >}} Slides and Tutorials | | | | |--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----| ## {{< fa envelope >}} Introduction Network Diagrams are important in data visualization to bring out relationships between diverse entities. They are used in ecology, biology, transportation, and even history! And hey, whom did Jon Snow marry? ## {{< fa asterisk >}} References 1. Michael Gastner, [Data Analysis and Visualisation with R, Chapter 23: Networks](https://michaelgastner.com/DAVisR2021/chap-networks.html) 2. David Schoch, [Network Visualizations in R using ggraph and graphlayouts](http://mr.schochastics.net/netVizR.html) 3. Konrad M. Lawson, [Toilers and Gangsters:Simple Network Visualization with R for Historians](https://kmlawson.github.io/dh-tutorials/network.html)
